thread.title: Zobrist homer leads Royals over Blue Jays, 14-2

title: Zobrist homer leads Royals over Blue Jays, 14-2
text:

Dickey's fourth pitch of the game as the Kansas City Royals routed the Toronto Blue Jays 14-2. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Zobrist homer leads Royals over Blue Jays, 14-2 Associated Press, AP 8:10 p.m. EDT October 20, 2015 The Royals second baseman Ben Zobrist (18) celebrates after hitting a two run home run against the Toronto Blue Jays in game four of the ALCS at Rogers Centre. (Photo: John E. Sokolowski-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
TORONTO (AP) - Ben Zobrist hit a two-run homer on knuckleballer R.A. Dickey's fourth pitch of the game, Alex Rios connected an inning later and the Kansas City Royals routed the Toronto Blue Jays 14-2 Tuesday to move one win from a second straight World Series. Kansas City moved ahead 3-1 in the best-of-seven AL Championship Series and can win the pennant Wednesday, when Edinson Volquez starts against Toronto's Marco Estrada in a Game 1 rematch. Lorenzo Cain scored on a passed ball and Mike Moustakas had a sacrifice fly in an LCS-record four-run top of the first. Kansas led 5-2 in the seventh before breaking away. Blue Jays infielder Cliff Pennington relieved in the ninth inning, becoming the first primarily position player to pitch in the postseason, STATS said.
